edu.luc.cs.trull
Class Control

java.lang.Object
  edu.luc.cs.trull.EmptyComponent
      edu.luc.cs.trull.TerminatingComponent
          edu.luc.cs.trull.AbstractComponent
              edu.luc.cs.trull.AbstractCombinator
                  edu.luc.cs.trull.Control
All Implemented Interfaces:
Combinator, Component, java.util.EventListener, java.beans.PropertyChangeListener, PropertyChangeSource, SchedulerAware, Startable, Suspendable, Terminating
Direct Known Subclasses:
AwaitOne, Watching
public class Control
extends AbstractCombinator

A combinator that maps sets of events to a component's lifecycle methods start and stop. It behaves as follows: initially, it waits and does nothing. If and when any it receives one of the starting events, it starts the body component. If the body reaches termination, this component also terminates. However, if it receives a stopping event before the body terminates, it stops the body and starts the handler; in this case, this component terminates when the handler terminates. This combinator is a generalization of AwaitOne and Watching, which are provided for convenience as subtypes of this combinator. 

 await START ->
   do 
     body
   watching STOP ->
     handler

See Also:
AwaitOne, Watching

Constant Field Values
Constructor Detail

Control

public Control()
Constructs a Control component whose body is an non-terminating empty component (Nil) and whose handler is an empty component that terminates immediately (Done). Specific properties can be changed later.

See Also:
Nil, Done

Control

public Control(java.lang.String[] startLabels,
               Component body,
               java.lang.String[] stopLabels)
Control(startLabels, body, stopLabels, new Done())

Control

public Control(java.lang.String[] startLabels,
               Component body,
               java.lang.String[] stopLabels,
               Component handler)
Control(startLabels, null, body, stopLabels, null, handler)

Control

public Control(java.lang.String[] startLabels,
               java.beans.PropertyChangeListener startAction,
               Component body,
               java.lang.String[] stopLabels,
               java.beans.PropertyChangeListener stopAction,
               Component handler)
Constructs a Control component.

Parameters:
startLabels - the array of event labels that cause the body to start.
startAction - the action invoked when a start event is received. May be null.
body - the body component to be started after a start event is received. If null, a Nil component is used.
stopLabels - the array of event labels that cause the body to stop.
stopAction - the action invoked when a stop event is received. May be null.
handler - the component to be started after a stop event is received. If null, a Done component is used.

Control

public Control(java.lang.String startLabel,
               Component body,
               java.lang.String stopLabel)
Control([startLabel], body, [stopLabel], new Done())

Control

public Control(java.lang.String startLabel,
               Component body,
               java.lang.String stopLabel,
               Component handler)
Control([startLabel], body, [stopLabel], handler)

Control

public Control(java.lang.String startLabel,
               java.beans.PropertyChangeListener startAction,
               Component body,
               java.lang.String stopLabel,
               java.beans.PropertyChangeListener stopAction,
               Component handler)
Control([startLabel], startAction, body, [stopLabel], stopAction, handler)
